ins:fingering.name: Standard
ins:fingering.comment: Using the Bb Thumb Key. Use in passages without B-naturals

ins:fingering.name: Alternate
ins:fingering.comment: When Bb Thumb can't be used

ins:fingering.name: Trill
ins:fingering.comment: For trills or passing passages using B-natural

ins:fingering.name: Alternate
ins:fingering.comment: When Bb Thumb can't be used

ins:fingering.name: Trill
ins:fingering.comment: For trills or passing passages using B-natural

ins:fingering.name: Sharp
ins:fingering.comment: Sharp. Harder to crack to A5

ins:fingering.name: Slur
ins:fingering.comment: Sharp. Slur from F or F#

ins:fingering.name: Clear
ins:fingering.comment: Clear and in tune with response similar to D6

ins:fingering.name: C#Foot
ins:fingering.comment: Use in combination with F6, F#6 and A6 fingerings using the C# foot key

ins:fingering.name: C#Trill
ins:fingering.comment: For models with C# trill key

ins:fingering.name: Clear
ins:fingering.comment: Clearer, less shrill and more in tune

ins:fingering.name: Alt4
ins:fingering.comment: Good response. Useful in Prokoviev Sonata, 1st Mvt

ins:fingering.name: Alt5
ins:fingering.comment: Easy to finger, harder response than when foot keys are also depressed

ins:fingering.name: Alt5
ins:fingering.comment: Difficult to finger on open-hole models

ins:fingering.name: Alt6
ins:fingering.comment: Awkward but in tune. Press both the rim of F key nd the D trill key with RH 1

ins:fingering.name: Alt13
ins:fingering.comment: Sharp, requires very fast air stream

ins:fingering.name: Absurd
ins:fingering.comment: Requires closed C# cup (e.g. with knee)

ins:fingering.name: Kicker
ins:fingering.comment: Requires kicker. Pull back with RH Thumb and trill the tone hole.

ins:fingering.name: Absurd
ins:fingering.comment: Close C# cup, e.g. with knee

ins:fingering.name: Alt-BbF
ins:fingering.comment: Flat Interval. Without Bb Thumb or F

ins:fingering.name: Standard
ins:fingering.comment: Basic. Can slightly close LH1 to improve tone

ins:fingering.name: Standard
ins:fingering.comment: Basic. Can slightly close LH1 to improve tone.

ins:fingering.name: Alt-BbF
ins:fingering.comment: Flat Interval. Without Bb Thumb or F

ins:fingering.name: BestBFoot
ins:fingering.comment: In tune. Best on B-Foot flutes

ins:fingering.name: C#Trill
ins:fingering.comment: Basic for flutes with C# Trill

ins:fingering.name: Alt3
ins:fingering.comment: Sharp. Good response for ff. A little awkward

ins:fingering.name: Picc
ins:fingering.comment: Interval more in tune. Good for Piccolo

ins:fingering.name: Alt3
ins:fingering.comment: Awkward but more in tune B

ins:fingering.name: Alt5
ins:fingering.comment: Flat B. Vent RH2 as needed

ins:fingering.name: Kicker
ins:fingering.comment: Anchor flute by placing LH pinky under flute below the G# key, close RH 3 key ring by using right thumb to pull the kicker away from the flute, then trill the RH 3 tone hole while key ring remains depressed

ins:fingering.name: Kicker
ins:fingering.comment: Anchor flute by placing LH pinky under flute below the G# key, close RH 3 key ring by using right thumb to pull the kicker away from the flute, then trill the RH 3 tone hole while key ring remains depressed

ins:fingering.name: Knee
ins:fingering.comment: Lean down to the right and close both the C and C# cups (keys) with the right knee. Trill with the Eb key

ins:fingering.name: Picc
ins:fingering.comment: Basic. For piccolo. B is slightly sharp, but D is in tune, making a slightly sharp interval.

ins:fingering.name: Standard
ins:fingering.comment: Use RH ring finger on RH 2 key. Aim for Gb

ins:fingering.name: Standard
ins:fingering.comment: A responds better than C#. Emphasize C#

ins:fingering.name: CFoot
ins:fingering.comment: Requires airstream adjustment for each note. For C-Foot models

ins:fingering.name: CFoot2
ins:fingering.comment: Requires less airstream adjustment. For C-Foot models
